DOC.HEAD: Romanian Agency Says Olympic Shooters Help Quell ``Terrorists''
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Three Romanian Olympic and world shooting experts performed ``genuine acts of heroism '' by annihilating a group of ``terrorists'' in Bucharest, the Romanian news agency Agerpres said Wednesday. The agency, monitored in Vienna, said Ion Corneliu, Sorin Babii and Gratian Calota ``fought at Ghencea Military Cemetery where they annihilated a group of terrorists that furiously attacked an important military target in the area.'' The report did not say who the terrorists were, but they were presumably loyal to deposed dictator Nicolae Ceausescu. It did not give a specific date for that encounter nor for others in which it said athletes paid a part. Agerpres said wrestlers Catalin Rosca and Ionel Baciu were helping the militia at the Chitial checkpoint at the entrance to the capital. Soccer players from Bucharest's Dinamo team fought alongside the army in the palace square and Dinamo athletes now guarded the emergency hospital, the agency said.
